page.title: 05Mabe Burnthouse
page.content: Mabe is a small village nestling on the granite hillside at an elevation of about{130}metres and overlooking the waters of{Carrick roads.} The old school and the ancient{St {Laudus}church were both constructed of the granite on which{Mabe}stands.The local quarries have long sent building stone around the world and continued to provide employment today. The majority of the working population today travel to{Penryn, {Falmouth or Truro}and most of the dwellings in the village are bungalows built in the{1960's}and{1970's.}Our surveys have shown a village population of{703. }
